results.title: A Simple song
results.creator_credit: Paola Garofali, Adrian Wills and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
The age-old struggle for understanding between generations is captured in this musical about finding the courage to be yourself.
Cast: Nick Simpson-Deeks, Ross McGregor, Ashley Swift

results.title: The Road home
results.creator_credit: Robert Nugent, Kelrick Martin and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Documentary about Roy Read who was raised an orphan and told he wasn’t Aboriginal - just “darker than others”. At Kinchela Boys’ Home he was subjected to the horrors of institutionalised life. Now 49 years later, he returns to face the demons of his past - and reconnect with the family he never knew he had. Contains archival b&w stills
results.description: Documentary about Roy Read who was raised an orphan and told he wasn’t Aboriginal - just “darker than others”. results.title: Redreaming the dark
results.creator_credit: Romaine Moreton, Charlotte Seymour, Erica Glynn and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
During an electricity blackout in the family apartment, a young intellectually challenged Black woman has her life suddenly thrown into turmoil. Her grandmother soothes the young girl, teaching her not only to embrace the dark but also to love her dark self. Together the three women “redream” the dark.
Cast: Emily Walker, Leah Purcell, Irma Woods
results.creator_credit_for_label: Romaine Moreton, Charlotte Seymour, Erica Glynn and AFTRS

results.title: Artists at Work
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: School of Paris (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Artists at Work”.
Five contemporary artists at work in Paris: Dewasne, working in pure colours, primaries dominating, the work somewhere between music and architecture; Di Teana, at work in steel, winner of the Prix de Saint Goba, 1962; Fruhtrunk - bands orange to black, the colours play as a Bach fugue; Weisbuch - continues the Daumier tradition - and winner of the Prix de la Critique for the best show in Paris, 1961; and Hartung - one of the most important influences on abstract, and prize winner at the Venice Biennale, 1960.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Artists at Work”.
Five contemporary artists at work in Paris: Dewasne, working in pure colours, primaries dominating, the work somewhere between music and architecture; Di Teana, at work in steel, winner of the Prix de Saint Goba, 1962; Fruhtrunk - bands orange to black, the colours play as a Bach fugue; Weisbuch - continues the Daumier tradition - and winner of the Prix de la Critique for the best show in Paris, 1961; and Hartung - one of the most important influences on abstract, and prize winner at the Venice Biennale, 1960.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Artists at Work”.
Five contemporary artists at work in Paris: Dewasne, working in pure colours, primaries dominating, the work somewhere between music and architecture; Di Teana, at work in steel, winner of the Prix de Saint Goba, 1962; Fruhtrunk - bands orange to black, the colours play as a Bach fugue; Weisbuch - continues the Daumier tradition - and winner of the Prix de la Critique for the best show in Paris, 1961; and Hartung - one of the most important influences on abstract, and prize winner at the Venice Biennale, 1960.

results.title: Range of experience
results.creator_credit: Lisa Duff, Marc Gillezeau, Maryella Hatfield and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
It is the future - a world where the ability to experience life’s basic emotions has been lost to humanity and Virtual Reality has replaced dreams. The company Range of Experience Productions Inc has invented the Dream Base Selector, a machine which enables users to re-live experiences once created naturally by the subconscious mind. But it soon becomes apparent that the technology is slightly faulty…
Cast: Soledad Cordeaux

results.title: Midas
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Isabel Perez and Niki Bern
results.brief_description: ‘Midas’ is a retelling of the story of King Midas and the Golden Touch. It is told from the perspective of the narrator who read the tale over and over again as a child. The film begins brightly but becomes darker as some of the narration’s unspoken implications are revealed. Narrated by Zoe Carides.
results.description: ‘Midas’ is a retelling of the story of King Midas and the Golden Touch. It is told from the perspective of the narrator who read the tale over and over again as a child. The film begins brightly but becomes darker as some of the narration’s unspoken implications are revealed. Narrated by Zoe Carides.

results.title: Louise
results.creator_credit: Kelly Schilling, Joe Weatherstone, Steven McGregor and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A short documentary about a woman named Louise Mitchie who was born as a replacement child - a child conceived and born in order to help with the grief experienced by parents who had lost their first child in infancy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kelly Schilling, Joe Weatherstone, Steven McGregor and AFTRS

Not paid sex, not Sleep-Eez, not working the late-night shift can help Danny sleep. Not until his ritual gets invaded by a girl.

results.title: The Lama of Greystanes
results.brief_description:
Zatul Rinzin Rinpoche is the 11th reincarnation of the lama (or spiritual leader) of the highest monastery in the world, Rongbuk, which lies at the foot of Mount Everest in western Tibet.
In 1959, when the Chinese invaded Tibet, Rinzin was forced to flee his homeland. Now 57, he lives in Greystanes in the outer western suburbs of Sydney with his wife and three children.
Rinzin is no longer a monk but he is still a lama - a responsibility he must hold his entire life. He now works as a security guard to support himself, his family and his monastery back in Tibet.
results.description:
Zatul Rinzin Rinpoche is the 11th reincarnation of the lama (or spiritual leader) of the highest monastery in the world, Rongbuk, which lies at the foot of Mount Everest in western Tibet.
In 1959, when the Chinese invaded Tibet, Rinzin was forced to flee his homeland. Now 57, he lives in Greystanes in the outer western suburbs of Sydney with his wife and three children.
Rinzin is no longer a monk but he is still a lama - a responsibility he must hold his entire life. He now works as a security guard to support himself, his family and his monastery back in Tibet.

Zatul Rinzin Rinpoche is the 11th reincarnation of the lama (or spiritual leader) of the highest monastery in the world, Rongbuk, which lies at the foot of Mount Everest in western Tibet.
In 1959, when the Chinese invaded Tibet, Rinzin was forced to flee his homeland. Now 57, he lives in Greystanes in the outer western suburbs of Sydney with his wife and three children.
Rinzin is no longer a monk but he is still a lama - a responsibility he must hold his entire life. He now works as a security guard to support himself, his family and his monastery back in Tibet.
